seller_statement: I’ll think about it and get back to you.
response: Sure — and I respect that. Just so I’m not following up endlessly and bugging you, what specifically are you needing time to consider?
follow_up_prompt: If nothing changes in your situation over the next few days, would you still be open to revisiting this?

seller_statement: I don’t want anyone walking through the house right now.
response: Totally fair — especially these days, privacy and peace of mind matter. We usually don’t need any walk-throughs unless you’re comfortable and we’re already in escrow.
follow_up_prompt: Is it mostly a timing thing, or just not wanting people in the house at all?

seller_statement: I just want to see what you’d offer.
response: Absolutely — and I’d love to make something work if it’s a fit. Usually, though, I can be more accurate if I know what kind of outcome you’re looking for.
follow_up_prompt: If you had a magic wand and could sell it the exact way you want, what would that look like?

seller_statement: I might list it later if this doesn’t work.
response: Makes sense — you want to leave your options open, and that’s smart. Listing can work well for some, but it’s a different route with pros and cons.
follow_up_prompt: Is your main goal to maximize price, or to sell quickly and without hassle?

seller_statement: My neighbor sold for more than that.
response: Yeah, I hear that a lot — and sometimes those sales can skew expectations a bit. Every property’s different based on condition, updates, and buyer type.
follow_up_prompt: Do you know if your neighbor’s place had any recent upgrades or was it in top condition when it sold?

seller_statement: I’m just gathering information right now.
response: Totally fine — I don’t expect you to make a decision today. Most of the people I talk to are in that same place at first.
follow_up_prompt: Is there anything specific you’re hoping to understand better before making a decision?

seller_statement: I just don’t know enough about this process yet.
response: Makes sense — it’s not something you deal with every day. That’s exactly why we’re here, to help walk you through it and simplify everything.
follow_up_prompt: Would you like me to give you a quick overview now, or would it be better if I sent a summary and we talked after?

seller_statement: I might just keep it as a rental.
response: That could be a good plan, especially if it’s already bringing in some cash flow. Out of curiosity, are you dealing with any tenant headaches or maintenance issues?
follow_up_prompt: If you were to sell, what would make it worth your while to let it go instead?

seller_statement: I’m not selling for a lowball cash offer.
response: Totally get that — we’re not here to insult anyone. Our cash offers are based on real numbers and only make sense if they work for both sides.
follow_up_prompt: Are you open to at least seeing how it’s calculated to compare, or are you leaning more toward retail at this point?

seller_statement: I might just fix it up myself and sell it later.
response: That’s one way to go, for sure — and in the right market, it can work out well. Do you already have a crew lined up or just exploring the idea for now?
follow_up_prompt: If I could show you what you’d walk away with now versus after repairs — without the hassle — would you be open to comparing?

category: Wants to Inherit or Leave to Family
seller_statement: I’m planning to leave this property to my kids.
response: Totally understandable — a lot of people want to pass something down. That’s a really meaningful reason to hold onto it.
follow_up_prompt: Are they planning to move in, or is it more of an investment for them down the road?

seller_statement: Someone else already made me an offer.
response: Got it — and I’m glad you’re getting options. May I ask, how was the experience so far? Some buyers overpromise or vanish when it’s time to close.
follow_up_prompt: Do you mind sharing what they offered? That helps me see if I can do better or if you’ve already got a great deal.

seller_statement: My agent told me it’s worth way more than that.
response: Totally fair — agents usually aim for top dollar, which makes sense in a retail setting. Our buyers look at it a little differently since they’re factoring in costs, time, and risk.
follow_up_prompt: Did your agent say how long it might take to sell at that price, or if repairs would be needed first?

seller_statement: This sounds kind of shady. I’ve never heard of selling like this.
response: Totally fair — this isn’t the traditional way, and most people feel unsure the first time they hear it. We’re happy to walk through exactly how it works and show how we protect sellers throughout.
follow_up_prompt: Would you feel more comfortable if I sent over past deals or reviews first?

category: Wants to Move at Their Own Pace
seller_statement: I’m not in a rush — I’ll wait for the right price.
response: Makes sense — you’ve got time on your side, and that’s a good position to be in. Just curious, though, if something came along that made sense now, would you consider it?
follow_up_prompt: Is your ideal price based more on what you need to walk away with or what you feel the property is worth?
